title:
A symbolic computational approach to the generalized gambler's ruin
  problem in one and two dimensions
abstract:
The power of symbolic computation, as opposed to mere numerical computation,
is illustrated with efficient algorithms for studying the generalized gambler's
ruin problem in one and two dimensions. We also consider a new generalization
of the classical gambler's ruin where we add a third step which we call the
mirror step. In this scenario, we provide closed formulas for the probability
and expected duration.
